intro: Trachyandra eriocarpa, commonly known as the woolly trachyandra, is a member of the Asparagaceae family and is native to South Africa. It is a small, evergreen perennial shrub characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves that are covered in fine, soft hairs, contributing to its unique texture. It produces small, white or pale blue flowers in clusters, which are typically borne on short, erect stems. Trachyandra eriocarpa is adapted to grow in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions.
